etymologies: Middle English: from Old French avence (medieval Latin avencia), of unknown origin

definitions: a plant of the rose family, typically having serrated, divided leaves and seeds bearing small hooks. Several kinds are grown in gardens.

notes.text: Genus Geum, family Rosaceae: several species, including the widespread water avens (G. rivale), with drooping pinkish flowers, and the mat-forming alpine avens (G. montanum)

shortDefinitions: plant of rose family divided leaves and seeds bearing small hooks
